ygData.subject: Re: 3rd crash (segfault) with 1.14.3 on a large crawl with large seed list
ygData.msgSnippet: I m crawling geocities.com to archive it before the close the doors this summer.  I can t use the main url as a single seed because their front page doesn t

I'm crawling geocities.com to archive it before the close the doors this su=
mmer.  I can't use the main url as a single seed because their front page d=
oesn't link to any internal sites and very few of the internal sites link t=
o each other.  I managed to generate a seed list of as many html/text urls =
that I could find (the 7M) and I'm using that as the seed list - which seem=
ed to load all 7M properly (it threw out a few thousand when initially pars=
ing it), and ran for 5 days or so, but then died.

I was wondering - I redu=
ced the max-delay-ms to 2 seconds (2000 ms) and was wondering if this could=
've forced a bunch of threads to get locked-up if the connection got slow o=
r something - the dump shows that many of the toe threads were "Thread_bloc=
ked", which sounds bad to me, so it could be that there were no available t=
hreads due to the timeouts that I changed.  Could that be a possible issue?=


- Steve

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, John Lekashman <lekash@.=
..> wrote:
>
> Yeah, there seem to be some challenges with the really
> lon=
g seed lists.
> 
> Have you tried partitioning it into 10 or 20 separate cr=
awls,
> and running that?
> 
> Are you actually crawling from the seeds, or=
 just
> intending to download just those pages?
> 
> 7m is a lot of seeds a=
s a crawl basis.
> You might re-consider the structure of what you are doin=
g.
> 
> john
